summary:
I am Ashween, 39 years old and grew up in Eindhoven.

As a Supply Chain Specialist I have gained broad experience in doing planning related improvement projects for large (multinational) companies in industries like process consultancy, life science, and semi-conductor. I also worked as Demand Planner and Project Lead at ASML and Medtronic. In 2015, I started as Supply Chain Specialist at Accenture, a subsidiary of the Customer Supply Chain Management department of After Service for client ASML. In this job my responsibilities were to design, develop and execute a standardized and structured demand planning process.

Respected for my independence of view strength of mind. Leading from the front. Find occasions to go out and network and present my finding to the team with enthusiasm. Prefer working in high pressure environment to  drive myself and other to attain goals. My superiors have repeatedly recognized me for my interpersonal skills as well as for my drive and courage to overcome obstacles.

My passion is to cultivate ties between Commercial and Supply Chain and connect its people with the aim to improve planning processes and collaborations in a innovative way to Business Development. Preferably large company (multinational) and with design innovative products

profile_positions.description:
Demand lead and Gatekeeper CAL (Customer Allocation List)
- Manage Demand & Supply balance properly to keep Customer Allocation List at healthy and agreed financial level.
- Chair meetings to review Frozen horizon and risk of last minutes changes and guide stakeholders to correct direction.
- Take initiative to adjust plan accordingly when any deviation is found.
- Respond quickly and take appropriate action to monitor, track, and communicate status of critical customer reallocations.
- Maintain escalation flow to staff management and board of management
profile_positions.title: Integrated Business Planner

company.name: e-Luscious B2C Wine, Coffee and more

profile_positions.description:
Working at the Supply Chain Planning team EMEA for the Business Unit Diabetes. Responsible for following: 

Product lifecycle management:
-	End of Life, 
-	New Product Introductions, readiness product
-	Install base management,

Demand Planning,
-	Forecast Accuracy management:
-       Interact with Marketing: understand forecast drivers, indentify opportunities and vulnerebilities in the demand plan
-       Develop forecast demand on multiple levels of aggregation 
-       Review historical sales trends, research demand drivers, prepare forecast data, align on decision making to statistical or consensus forecast and evaluate forecast
-	Translate strategic goals of the business to Demand & Supply Plans,
-	Advise stakeholders about different assumptions, give insight in risk and opportunities and give guidance to decisions in unbalance situations, 
-	Scenario planning to supply chain planning lead in monthly S&OP cycles to capture relevant data,
-	Rolling Forecast vs. actual Sales,

Supply Planning:
-	Demand & Supply coordination,
-	Safety Stock planning,

Natural cooperator in Complaint handling of products.

Overall keep focus on main regions, analyze input and consult stakeholders about the decision on growth which can gain the company. 
Designing a new more standardized version of the process including its enablers like reporting
profile_positions.title: Supply Chain Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Working at ASML : 4x factories, 2x Central warehouses and 60x locations close to ASML customers. In total 11000 service parts and 7000 service tools.

Module Build coordinator at Twinscan Factory ASML:
-	Demand & Supply maintenance between extern suppliers and internal makes,
-       Maintain Refurbishment planning and Value Stream Mapping,
-       Monitor Kanban settings,
-	Align facilities for cleanroom space and resource plan with capacity requirement and drive timely decision making for capacity extension
-	Improve daily KPI’s to automated updating D&S
-	Analyze New Product Introductions exceptions on implementation to the production floor
-	Natural cooperator critical material teams,  allocate materials to prioritize demand to ASML customers 
-	Roll up for production progress towards weekly masterplan updates, identify risks and create scenarios for decision making of optimizing plan
profile_positions.title: Production Planning Control

profile_positions.description:
Critical Material Management Analyst at Accenture; Business Process Services
- Stakeholder alignment to Demand- & Supply parties regarding escalation  levels
- Ensure goals, scope and product domain will be understood by all
- Ensure that product backlog is visible, transparant and clear to all
- Participating in technical interface discussions 
- Align on front- end development
- On site in the United States to lead Demand & Supply management project at Wilton Factory ASML (Connecticut, USA) as Project coordinator to knowledge transfer to reverse shadow and metrics development.
profile_positions.title: Business Process Delivery Analyst

profile_positions.description:
- Senior end to end planning, CAPEX Customer Supply Chain Management monitoring. 
- Analysis misalignment service tooling between Demand and Supply and implement structured perception on weekly FTE of ownership BPO ,
- Read people, understand values, motives that drive behaviours and create/ maintain a large trusted network at all levels
- Stabilizing of transition in tool planning processes: KPI management and Knowledge spares to built relationship in trust and increase sales in new assignments supply chain service tools.
profile_positions.title: Business Operations Analyst

profile_positions.description:
- Spare parts end to end service planning, monitoring, improving and standardizing of KPI /MRP processes. 
- Achieving targets on Critical spare parts management, Reduced criticallity 87% to balance“end to end” planning to factories Wilton US, Linkou Taiwan and San Diego US.
profile_positions.title: Business Process Professional
